bcbioSingleCell
  • Reference
  • News

Filter Cells

Apply gene detection, mitochondrial abundance, and novelty score cutoffs to cellular barcodes.

filterCells(object, ...)

# S4 method for bcbioSingleCell
filterCells(object, aggregateReplicates = FALSE,
  minUMIs = 1000, minGenes = 500, maxGenes = Inf, maxMitoRatio = 0.1,
  minNovelty = 0.8, minCellsPerGene = 3, showReport = TRUE,
  headerLevel = 2)

# S4 method for bcbioSCDataSet
filterCells(object)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments (for the S4 generic definition).
aggregateReplicates

Aggregate technical replicates, if specified. This function uses values assigned in the sampleNameAggregate column of the internal sample metadata data.frame.
minUMIs

Minimum number of UMI disambiguated counts per cell.
minGenes

Minimum number of genes detected.
maxGenes

Maximum number of genes detected.
maxMitoRatio

Maximum relative mitochondrial abundance (0-1 scale).
minNovelty

Minimum novelty score.
minCellsPerGene

Include genes with non-zero expression in at least this many cells.
showReport

Show summary statistics report and plots.
headerLevel

RMarkdown header level, if showReport = TRUE.

Value

bcbioSingleCell object, with filtering information slotted into metadata() as filterCells and filterParams.

Note

This operation can be re-run on a bcbioSingleCell object that has been previously filtered. This function simply saves filterCells and filterParams vectors into the metadata() slot.

See also

Seurat::CreateSeuratObject().

Other Data Management Utilities: aggregateFeatures, aggregateReplicates, readMarkers, subsetPerSample

Examples

# NOT RUN {
data(bcb)
bcb <- filterCells(bcb)
# }
